JobTitle: US-E-EA - Internal Communications Specialist - Deloitte Consulting New Business Innovation & Cross-Consulting Priorities
JobFullDesc: Internal Communications Specialist - Deloitte Consulting New Business Innovation & Cross-Consulting PrioritiesAre you a strong communicator and creative problem solver who is not afraid to think differently and find opportunity where others don't? Do you have a strategic and executional mindset that can guide multiple internal stakeholders while delivering high-value communications results that drive business objectives and employee engagement?We are seeking a communications specialist to join our Consulting Marketing team to lead the strategic planning and execution of internal communications for high-priority cross-consulting topics, including a portfolio of transformational and emerging new businesses.What you'll do:You will work closely with senior business leaders as well as our Consulting Marketing team to coordinate efforts in support of Consulting's high growth businesses by helping to:Build integrated communications and marketing strategies and execution plans aligned to business priorities and grounded in communications' best practices and a deep understanding of how the business operatesRegularly collect and analyze data to support business and marketing stakeholders in understanding performance of communications' tactics; adjust strategies and optimize approaches in an agile fashion based on performance benchmarks and KPIsCraft and deliver impactful content designed around storytelling principles to drive meaningful engagement with internal audiencesCollaborate and align with internal stakeholders to activate and cascade priority business messages and campaigns across network channelsIdeate and explore creative and innovative approaches to engage and/or target internal audiencesManage and optimize internal communications channels and vehicles in support of strategic business priorities to maximize impactLiaise with junior resources to support execution and performance measurement / metrics of internal communications tacticsSupport ongoing best practice sharing across communications, marketing, and business stakeholders / cohorts in support of communications excellence across the organizationInvestigate and pilot technologies designed to enhance the impact of the internal communications organizationThe team:Deloitte's Consulting Marketing team provides value to the US Firms by differentiating the Deloitte brand, driving Deloitte's business priorities forward, innovating new marketing and communications solutions, and delivering distinct client experiences. We develop cutting-edge marketing and communications plans, creative assets, and unique experiences that engage our internal and external audiences; deliver on the strategy of our businesses; and capture the hearts, minds, and loyalty of our clients.Qualifications include:Communications professional with a minimum of 5-7 years relevant experienceBachelor's degree with a focus in Business, Marketing, Communications, Public Relations, English, and/or JournalismStrong organizational and project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage expectations across multiple, complex projects/prioritiesAnalytical mindset, with ability to interpret data into meaningful insights and strategiesDetail-oriented with fantastic follow-through skillsExcellent verbal and written communication skills-including effective storytelling, presentation skills, and ability to engage with Executive LeadershipAbility to work in a matrixed organization with a cross-functional, virtual team; experience in large corporate settings and/or professional services a plusFlexibility and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, while possessing a high level of comfort with ambiguityVery strong executive presence and comfort working with and advising senior leadersProficient in MS Office suite-including Teams, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and One Drive; knowledge of the latest internal communications measurement platforms a plusTravel up to 15% (While 15% of travel is a requirement of the role, due to COVID-19, non-essential travel has been suspended until further notice.)Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future.
